Fort Sumpter is a modern truncated pen tagonal fort, built upon an artificial island at the mouth of Charleston harbor, three and tbree-eigth miles from the city of Charleston. The island has for its base a sand and mud bank, with a superstructure, if we may so term it, of the refuse chips from several northern granite quarries. These rocks are firmly imbedded in the sand, and upon them the present fortification is reared. The island itself cost half a mil lion dollars, and was ten years in construc tion- The fortification cost another half a million dollars, and at the time of its occu pancy by Major Anderson was so nearly completed as to admit the introduction of its armament...

THE BOSTON SUBWAY To Be Open to Traffic on September 1. Boston, Aug. 8. —The Boston subway will be opened to public travel on Sep tember 1; at least, that Is the present intention of the West End Street Rail way Company. It is not expected to have all the details of construction com pleted at that time, but they will be sufficiently advanced to warrant the dedication of the first three sections to the uses of the electrical transit system. All the ticket offices and turnstiles at the foot of the station stairways are practically completed, and are now be ing painted to conform with the in terior finish of the subway.
